text: Garbiñe Muguruza (born 8 October 1993 in Caracas, Venezuela) is a Venezuelan- born professional tennis player from Spain. She is two times Grand Slam winner, having won French Open in 2016 and Wimbledon in 2017.Spanish-Basque wins Women’s Wimbledon 2017 Retrieved 12 August 2018Garbiñe Muguruza beats Serena Williams to win French Open title – as it happened Retrieved 12 August 2018 Muguruza is a former world no.1 tennis player, she is currently ranked no.7.Muguruza's profile at WTA Retrieved 12 August 2018 ==Career statistics== ===Grand Slam tournament finals=== ====Singles: 3 (2 titles, 1 runner-up)==== Result Year Tournament Surface Opponent Score Runner-up 2015 Wimbledon Grass Serena Williams 4–6, 4–6 Winner 2016 French Open Clay Serena Williams 7–5, 6–4 Winner 2017 Wimbledon Grass Venus Williams 7–5, 6–0 ===Grand Slam tournament performance timelines=== ====Singles==== Tournament 2012 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 SR W–L Win% Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Major Tournaments Australian Open A 2R 4R 4R 3R QF 2R 0 / 6 14–6 French Open Q3 2R QF QF W 4R SF 1 / 6 24–5 Wimbledon Q2 2R 1R F 2R W 2R 1 / 6 16–5 US Open 1R A 1R 2R 2R 4R 0 / 5 5–5 Win–Loss 0–1 3–3 7–4 14–4 11–3 17–3 7–3 2 / 23 58–20 ====Doubles==== This table is current through the 2018 Australian Open Tournament 2013 2014 2015 2016 2017 2018 SR W–L Major Tournaments Australian Open A 2R 2R A A A 0 / 2 2–2 French Open 1R SF 1R A A A 0 / 3 4–3 Wimbledon 1R 3R 2R A A A 0 / 3 3–3 US Open A 3R 2R A A 0 / 2 3–2 Win–Loss 0–2 9–4 3–4 0–0 0–0 0–0 0 / 10 12–10 ==References== Category:1993 births Category:Female tennis players Category:Living people
